support state bankruptcy as a way to get out from under unsustainable public pension obligations. Bill Lockyer said that California has a plan to pay for its pension obligations, and bankruptcy is not part of it. We are dealing with them by reducing benefits and increasing employees' contributions, among other moves, Bill Lockyer said in a written statement.
